description:
'''Fred Lincoln''' "'''Link'''" '''Wray Jr.''' (May 2, 1929 â€“ November 5, 2005) was an American guitarist, songwriter, and vocalist who became popular in the late 1950s. His 1958 [[Instrumental rock|instrumental]] single "[[Rumble (instrumental)|Rumble]]", reached the top 20 in the United States; and was one of the earliest songs in rock music to utilize [[Distortion (guitar)|distortion]] and [[tremolo]].

''[[Rolling Stone]]'' ranked Wray at No. 45 on its list of the 100 greatest guitarists of all time. He received two nominations for the [[Rock and Roll Hall of Fame]], prior to being inducted in the Musical Influence category in 2023.
